response.overview: Our desire for sweets has a long history.  In Hawaii, favorable growing conditions created a thriving sugar industry, starting with the first sugar plantation in 1835.  This video takes you on a tour of Hawaii's last remaining sugar producing mill, operated by Hawaiian Commercial & Sugar Company on the island of Maui.  This video, produced in 2010, takes you on a tour of Hawaii's last remaining sugar producing mill, operated by Hawaiian Commercial & Sugar Company on the island of Maui.  As of 2017, the sugar mill has closed, but it is survived by the Alexander & Baldwin Sugar Museum.
response.tagline: A Tour of Hawaii's Last Sugar Producing Mill
response.title: From Cane to Sugar
